conclusion: Analyze forces acting on sphere A using problem conditions to find q/d.
Sphere A is on an inclined plane with angle θ, and sphere B is to the right at distance d.
Sphere A is stationary on the inclined plane, and tension in the wire is 0.
Electrostatic force constant is k, gravitational acceleration is g, spheres treated as point charges.
Wire parallel to inclined plane, fixed at top, attached to sphere A.
Sphere B is fixed, centers of spheres at same height.
Mass of sphere A is m, charge is +q, sphere B has equal charge.
Identify forces on sphere A: gravitational force mg downward, normal force perpendicular, electrostatic force kq^2/d^2 right.
Resolve gravitational force into components: mg sin θ parallel, mg cos θ perpendicular.
Equilibrium condition: net force along inclined plane is zero, electrostatic force balances gravitational component parallel.
Set up equilibrium equation: kq^2/d^2 = mg sin θ.
Solve for q/d: rearrange equation to q^2/d^2 = mg sin θ/k, take square root to get q/d = sqrt(mg sin θ/k).
Final answer: q/d = sqrt(mg sin θ/k).
